manifest.name: binary-extensions
manifest.readme:
# binary-extensions > List of binary file extensions The list is just a [JSON file](binary-extensions.json) and can be used anywhere. ## Install ``` $ npm install binary-extensions ``` ## Usage ```js const binaryExtensions = require('binary-extensions'); console.log(binaryExtensions); //=> ['3ds', '3g2', â€¦] ``` ## Related - [is-binary-path](https://github.com/sindresorhus/is-binary-path) - Check if a filepath is a binary file - [text-extensions](https://github.com/sindresorhus/text-extensions) - List of text file extensions ---
